Question: This person spent much of his boyhood at Ferry Farm in Stafford County near Fredericksburg.
Hints: In 1755, this person was the senior American aide to British General Edward Braddock on the ill-fated Braddock expedition.
The first statue to show this person on horseback was dedicated in 1856 and is located in Manhattan's Union Square.
Subsequently, this person was forced to retreat across the East River at night.
